New Records: Kyle Hendricks allowed only two singles and two walks over 7 1/3 innings, striking out two and retiring 11 batters in a row during a stretch of the game.
Key Match Events: Dansby Swanson doubled off Buck Farmer, leading to a three-run eighth inning where Isaac Paredes and Pete Crow-Armstrong had run-scoring singles.
Pre-Game Insights: Kyle Hendricks, a member of the 2016 World Series champions, was pitching his final start for the Cubs, who were facing the Cincinnati Reds.
Post-Match Reflections: Kyle Hendricks expressed his gratitude to his teammates and fans, mentioning the emotional moment of waving to fans after his potentially final start.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Reds have lost five consecutive games and were shut out for the 16th time this season, with their offense being described as 'dormant' by Reds interim manager Freddie Benavides.
Others: Cubs' pitching coach Tommy Hottovy was sent to the mound to pull Hendricks, and teammates assembled a pyramid of 22 baseballs to honor his 11 consecutive outs.
